result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Rellinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform nine hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and no possession of controlled substances except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

AODA, unless already done.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A. Rellinger

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing held on 5-14-18

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:00 am 
INCLUDES 18CF150, 16CM208, 15CF537, AND 14CF13. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 

PLEA HEARING IN 18CF150. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Manufacture-Deliver LSD/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Manufacture-Deliver LSD/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 18CF150 AND SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 16CM208, 15CF537, AND 14CF13. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 18CF150: Ct. 1>>7 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 4 years ES. 
                    : Ct. 3>>5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 2 years ES. 
In 16CM208: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC & 1 year ES. 
In 15CF537: Ct. 1>>3 years imprisonment - 2 years IC & 1 year ES. 
                    : Ct. 2>>3 years imprisonment - 2 years IC & 1 year ES. 
In 14CF13: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES>>AODA unless already done; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances and no possession of controlled substances except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharge. 

COURT finds the def entitled to jail credit as follows: 
In 18CF150>>96 days credit. 
In 16CM208>>115 days credit. 
In 15CF537>>264 days credit. 
In 14CF13>>335 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Adj: 11:15 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 14, 2018 at 11:00 am.
follow up on 4/30/18
Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 9, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Atty Silliman just appointed
PTC 4/9/18 @ 11:15am
probation revocation packet
Calendar call on March 19, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk Shirley.
Case Called: 8:48
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer.  Def appears with Atty Amanda Ley.
This was the time set for a BFH, Atty Ley states that the defendant wishes to do a plea today.
Atty Gramer requests to have the BW quashed. Court quashes BW.
Bond will not be forfeited.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to: Amend Count 1 to delete the 2nd and Subsequent portion.
Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: Amended Count 1>>Possession w/Intent to Deliver Meth>>No Contest.
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 4 years with Conditions of: 1 year MCJ w/8 months I&S for rule violations and is eligible for Huber or EMP, assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent, absolute sobriety, 100 hours of CS, AODA and any follow thru treatment, FTE/School, CC, DNA sample and surcharge if not already done. Sentence to begin within 45 days. 1 day credit.
